subject: Web3
title: Ethereum's Endgame
description: A fast breakdown of Ethereum's Endgame for builders.

hook.text: Vitalik outlined Ethereum's endgame: a base layer for security with thousands of rollups handling everything else.

buildup.text: The base chain would be simple and secure. All complex activity would happen on Layer 2 networks above it.

discovery.text: Users wouldn't know or care which layer they're on. The experience would feel like a single fast, cheap network.

twist.text: This vision requires solving interoperability. Moving between rollups is still clunky and fragmented.

climax.text: If it works, Ethereum becomes invisible infrastructure â€” like the internet protocols nobody thinks about.

punchline.text: Ethereum's goal is to become so good you forget it exists.

quiz.question: What is Ethereum's endgame vision?
options: A secure base layer with thousands of rollups handling activity
